values.description:
See pull request #1739

Allows plugins, tools, and events to be built on windows. Fixed dll imports/exports, added windows specfic includes (mostly winsock), and fixed code style to work on windows. Everything could be built if it were linked statically, but this is not what we want. This will be fixed as soon as some circular dependencies are resolved.For now plugin and event libraries are kept as SHARED so that it will build on Linux.
values.title: Redo of pull request #1739

summary.raw:
See pull request #1739

Allows plugins, tools, and events to be built on windows. Fixed dll imports/exports, added windows specfic includes (mostly winsock), and fixed code style to work on windows. Everything could be built if it were linked statically, but this is not what we want. This will be fixed as soon as some circular dependencies are resolved.For now plugin and event libraries are kept as SHARED so that it will build on Linux.
summary.html:
See pull request #1739

Allows plugins, tools, and events to be built on windows. Fixed dll imports/exports, added windows specfic includes (mostly winsock), and fixed code style to work on windows. Everything could be built if it were linked statically, but this is not what we want. This will be fixed as soon as some circular dependencies are resolved.For now plugin and event libraries are kept as SHARED so that it will build on Linux.

values.title: stubbing out pull request for pull request #1721 for gazebo 6 release

values.description:
* gui updates

* update joint vis

* add api to insert items

* add api to spawn, and install editor events header

* create nested model visuals

* merge

* remove comments

* initial support for nested models in the model editor

* align, snap, palette, edit existing nested model

* removed similar functions, the goal is to reuse as much code as possible among links and nested models

* reduce duplicate code for selection of links/nested models

* working on pose updates

* save nested models

* copy/paste nested models in the editor

* fix can link, rendering pose updates

* fixing selection

* add nested model world file

* fixing selection

* support inserting nested model from insert tab

* port joint fix

* hookup nested model events to SV

* add remove entity function

* fix unique names and clearing nested models on exit

* reset connection maker when exiting model editor

* added ability to append sdf elements to the model

* fix loading joints

* fix model editor joint name prefix, joint sdf generation, add canonical model

* add api to get nested model sdf

* support loading model states

* fix spawning nested model

* update selection min size

* fix model name when loading joints with scoped link names as parent/child and the topmost model name might have changed because there was already a model with that name

* comment out checking model name

* remove debug messages

* fix joints between link and nested model

* fix spawning nested model model maker visual

* Fixed

* merge

* fix move to

* fix move to pos

* initial checkin for region event box plugin

* adds updating of size and position

* adds in-region event detection

* wires in publishing of region inclusion events

* cleanup

* additions for testing region event box plugin

values.description:
This simplifies the `INTEGRATION_physics_friction` test by using the `msgs::*ToSDF` functions instead of crafting xml strings. It saves over 50 lines of code. It is similar to some of the changes made in pull request #1466.

It is not urgent.

* [no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/488/) has just one spurious test failure
* [trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/382/) has one different spurious test failure
* [homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/376/) is fine
values.title: Use ToSDF functions to simplify physics_friction test

values.description:
Some previous valgrind analysis identified some use of uninitialized variables `sa_flags` and `sa_mask` in the sigact structs. This can be reproduced with the following command:

~~~
valgrind --tool=memcheck gzserver --iters 10 --verbose
~~~

and shows the [following error](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/417c40a5489fb4bdb3f2#file-sigact_valgrind-L40-L50):

~~~
Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_mask) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff838 is on thread 1's stack

Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_flags) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff828 is on thread 1's stack
~~~

This initializes those struct fields. It is not urgent.

* [no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/489/) is clean
* [trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/383/) has just one spurious test failure
* [homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/377/) is fine
values.title: Initialize sigact struct fields that valgrind said were being used uninitialized

summary.raw:
Some previous valgrind analysis identified some use of uninitialized variables `sa_flags` and `sa_mask` in the sigact structs. This can be reproduced with the following command:

~~~
valgrind --tool=memcheck gzserver --iters 10 --verbose
~~~

and shows the [following error](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/417c40a5489fb4bdb3f2#file-sigact_valgrind-L40-L50):

~~~
Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_mask) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff838 is on thread 1's stack

Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_flags) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff828 is on thread 1's stack
~~~

This initializes those struct fields. It is not urgent.

* [no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/489/) is clean
* [trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/383/) has just one spurious test failure
* [homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/377/) is fine
summary.html:
Some previous valgrind analysis identified some use of uninitialized variables sa_flags and sa_mask in the sigact structs. This can be reproduced with the following command:

valgrind --tool=memcheck gzserver --iters 10 --verbose

and shows the following error:

Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_mask) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff838 is on thread 1's stack

Syscall param rt_sigaction(act->sa_flags) points to uninitialised byte(s)
   at 0x5CF8E4A: __libc_sigaction (sigaction.c:64)
   by 0x4E50D40: gazebo::Server::Run() (Server.cc:471)
   by 0x4022A8: main (server_main.cc:40)
 Address 0xffefff828 is on thread 1's stack

This initializes those struct fields. It is not urgent.

  • no-gpu build is clean
  • trusty nvidia has just one spurious test failure
  • homebrew build is fine

values.description:
issue #1670

Problem was that `RenderEngine` was found to have an invalid `this->overlaySystem` pointer value in [Load](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/28a449c0068e1f12b651152ca39b3138dcc66e2a/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc?at=camera_sensor_ogre1.9#RenderEngine.cc-135) function (even though it's set to `NULL` in constructor) so  the `overlaySystem`  object was never initialized - ogre then crashes due to invalid overlay system pointer.

Don't have a complete explanation for this but seems like it's caused by wrapping member variables with `#if` `#end` in singleton header files. Removing the macro fixes the problem. Also works with ogre 1.8 as `Ogre::OverlaySystem` is forward declared.

We did an interesting test - declared another member variable pointer at the end of the header file and that pointer becomes the one with invalid pointer value and no crashes.
values.title: Fix camera sensor crash when using ogre 1.9

summary.raw:
issue #1670

Problem was that `RenderEngine` was found to have an invalid `this->overlaySystem` pointer value in [Load](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/28a449c0068e1f12b651152ca39b3138dcc66e2a/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc?at=camera_sensor_ogre1.9#RenderEngine.cc-135) function (even though it's set to `NULL` in constructor) so  the `overlaySystem`  object was never initialized - ogre then crashes due to invalid overlay system pointer.

Don't have a complete explanation for this but seems like it's caused by wrapping member variables with `#if` `#end` in singleton header files. Removing the macro fixes the problem. Also works with ogre 1.8 as `Ogre::OverlaySystem` is forward declared.

We did an interesting test - declared another member variable pointer at the end of the header file and that pointer becomes the one with invalid pointer value and no crashes.
summary.html:
issue #1670

Problem was that RenderEngine was found to have an invalid this->overlaySystem pointer value in Load function (even though it's set to NULL in constructor) so the overlaySystem object was never initialized - ogre then crashes due to invalid overlay system pointer.

Don't have a complete explanation for this but seems like it's caused by wrapping member variables with #if #end in singleton header files. Removing the macro fixes the problem. Also works with ogre 1.8 as Ogre::OverlaySystem is forward declared.

We did an interesting test - declared another member variable pointer at the end of the header file and that pointer becomes the one with invalid pointer value and no crashes.

values.description:
Redo of pull request #1811.

Fix for issue #1670

We have to include `OGRE/OgrePrerequisites.h`, which is included by `OGRE/Ogre.h`. So we can use `ogre_gazebo.h`.
values.title: Fix for ogre 1.9

summary.raw:
Redo of pull request #1811.

Fix for issue #1670

We have to include `OGRE/OgrePrerequisites.h`, which is included by `OGRE/Ogre.h`. So we can use `ogre_gazebo.h`.
summary.html:
Redo of pull request #1811.

Fix for issue #1670

We have to include OGRE/OgrePrerequisites.h, which is included by OGRE/Ogre.h. So we can use ogre_gazebo.h.

values.description:
Backport of pull request #1812.

the ogre_gazebo.h header file must be included in order to use the `OGRE_VERSION` macros

These files were using the macros without including the headers. To see which files use the headers without including `ogre_gazebo.h`:

~~~
# on this branch
$ grep -L ogre_gazebo `grep -rlI OGRE_VERSION .`
./cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
./gazebo/rendering/ogre_gazebo.h
./CMakeLists.txt
./media/CMakeLists.txt
~~~

* [homebrew is fine](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/381)
* [no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/493/) is clean
values.title: Add missing ogre includes to ensure macros are properly defined

values.description:
Part 1 of an effort to remove circular dependencies in gazebo.

This pull request removes the `gazebo_[ode|simbody|dart|bullet]_physics` libraries, and instead compiles all the physics code into one `gazebo_physics` library.

End users should not be affected by this, unless they happen to directly link against one of the removed libraries instead of using pkg-config or cmake config.

[No gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/494)
values.title: Circular dependencies part1

summary.raw:
Part 1 of an effort to remove circular dependencies in gazebo.

This pull request removes the `gazebo_[ode|simbody|dart|bullet]_physics` libraries, and instead compiles all the physics code into one `gazebo_physics` library.

End users should not be affected by this, unless they happen to directly link against one of the removed libraries instead of using pkg-config or cmake config.

[No gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/494)
summary.html:
Part 1 of an effort to remove circular dependencies in gazebo.

This pull request removes the gazebo_[ode|simbody|dart|bullet]_physics libraries, and instead compiles all the physics code into one gazebo_physics library.

End users should not be affected by this, unless they happen to directly link against one of the removed libraries instead of using pkg-config or cmake config.

No gpu clean

values.description:
redo pull request #1549 and retarget of pull request #1793 to gazebo6

* implement stop_min_depth param in ode (analogous to min_depth for contacts, but for joint limits)
    * [main logic for doing that is here](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1793/issue_1536_joint_limit_jitter/diff#Ldeps/opende/src/joints/joint.cppT693)
* bunch of small style fixes in ode
* added tests for joint limits, this test exercises the bug fixed by pull request #1536.

values.reason: Declining due to test failures. Resubmit when jenkins no-gpu passes.

values.description:
On Ubuntu (Unity only?) if you choose Appearance->Behavior->Show the menus for a window->in the window's title bar, all dialogs on Gazebo receive a copy of the main window's menu like this:

![windowflags.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4038609099-windowflags.png)

On pull request #1800 @nkoenig added a solution for that for the DataLogger. This pull request does the same for all dialogs, while hiding/showing the close/min/max buttons appropriately.
values.title: Set window flags for all dialogs

On pull request #1800 @nkoenig added a solution for that for the DataLogger. This pull request does the same for all dialogs, while hiding/showing the close/min/max buttons appropriately.
summary.html:
On Ubuntu (Unity only?) if you choose Appearance->Behavior->Show the menus for a window->in the window's title bar, all dialogs on Gazebo receive a copy of the main window's menu like this:

On pull request #1800 @nkoenig added a solution for that for the DataLogger. This pull request does the same for all dialogs, while hiding/showing the close/min/max buttons appropriately.

values.description:
While working on an integration test for the Swarm project I noticed that the `gazebo-config.cmake` file shipped with Gazebo doesn't include `libgazebo_test_fixture` in `GAZEBO_LIBRARIES`.

I also added some missing libraries in the pkg_config gazebo file too.
values.title: Add extra gazebo libraries to config.cmake and pkg_config

summary.raw:
While working on an integration test for the Swarm project I noticed that the `gazebo-config.cmake` file shipped with Gazebo doesn't include `libgazebo_test_fixture` in `GAZEBO_LIBRARIES`.

I also added some missing libraries in the pkg_config gazebo file too.
summary.html:
While working on an integration test for the Swarm project I noticed that the gazebo-config.cmake file shipped with Gazebo doesn't include libgazebo_test_fixture in GAZEBO_LIBRARIES.

I also added some missing libraries in the pkg_config gazebo file too.

values.description:
Merge forward a few pull requests that went into gazebo5. This should wait until 6.0.0 has been released.

* pull request #1808: Use ToSDF functions to simplify physics_friction test

* pull request #1809: Initialize sigact struct fields that valgrind said were being used uninitialized

* pull request #1813: Add missing ogre includes to ensure macros are properly defined

* 52c93cc: Include ogre_gazebo.h in SelectionBuffer.cc, which wasn't part of pull request #1813 since this file didn't use the `OGRE_VERSION` macros in gazebo5
values.title: Merge gazebo5 to gazebo6 (wait until after 6.0.0)

  • 52c93cc: Include ogre_gazebo.h in SelectionBuffer.cc, which wasn't part of pull request #1813 since this file didn't use the OGRE_VERSION macros in gazebo5

values.description:
This pull request updates the DART interface for DART 5.0. Major code changes were made in the part of Model assembling.

In DART 5.0, links (dart::BodyNode) and joints cannot be created individually. [It should be created through its Model (dart::Skeleton) in the order of tree spanning like BFS or DFS](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/369). Gazebo however allows to create links and joints individually by parsing a SDF file in serial order using Model::Load(), and it doesn't guarantee that links and joints are parsed in the tree spanning order. That being said, the complete list of links and joints are required to build a dart::Skeleton. 

[It seems Model::Load() doesn't parse the joints under some condition](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/04c8460a5b855f9719c0cc306adf43f79064ed6a/gazebo/physics/Model.cc?at=default#Model.cc-92) so I put the model assembling code in DARTModel::Init(). After that, I found an issue that some code attempts to access member functions of Link and Joint in Model::Load() when DART objects are not created because Model::Init() is not called yet. I think they shouldn't be called before Joint and Link are initialized but I leave it since it looks out of scope of this PR.

I used caching method to resolve this issue. If a setter function is called before it's ready to be called then it caches the value or the function call itself (to avoid copy-and-paste the logic that used in the setter function), and returns when the corresponding getter function is called. This caching method doesn't work well for all the kind of setter/getter functions because many of them doesn't have one-to-one relationship (e.g., Joint::setAxis() and Joint::setGlobalAxis()), but this is the best solution I can think as of now. Please let me know if there is better idea.

Also, this PR partially fixes [DARTScrewJoint issue](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1096/dartscrewjoint-has-some-test-failures) by converting different definitions of thread pitch between Gazebo and DART.

I'm targeting this PR to gazebo6 since I believe this doesn't break API/ABI compatibility, but please let me know this should target to default.
values.title: DART interface update for DART 5.0

This pull request updates the DART interface for DART 5.0. Major code changes were made in the part of Model assembling.

In DART 5.0, links (dart::BodyNode) and joints cannot be created individually. [It should be created through its Model (dart::Skeleton) in the order of tree spanning like BFS or DFS](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/369). Gazebo however allows to create links and joints individually by parsing a SDF file in serial order using Model::Load(), and it doesn't guarantee that links and joints are parsed in the tree spanning order. That being said, the complete list of links and joints are required to build a dart::Skeleton. 

[It seems Model::Load() doesn't parse the joints under some condition](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/04c8460a5b855f9719c0cc306adf43f79064ed6a/gazebo/physics/Model.cc?at=default#Model.cc-92) so I put the model assembling code in DARTModel::Init(). After that, I found an issue that some code attempts to access member functions of Link and Joint in Model::Load() when DART objects are not created because Model::Init() is not called yet. I think they shouldn't be called before Joint and Link are initialized but I leave it since it looks out of scope of this PR.

I used caching method to resolve this issue. If a setter function is called before it's ready to be called then it caches the value or the function call itself (to avoid copy-and-paste the logic that used in the setter function), and returns when the corresponding getter function is called. This caching method doesn't work well for all the kind of setter/getter functions because many of them doesn't have one-to-one relationship (e.g., Joint::setAxis() and Joint::setGlobalAxis()), but this is the best solution I can think as of now. Please let me know if there is better idea.

Also, this PR partially fixes [DARTScrewJoint issue](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1096/dartscrewjoint-has-some-test-failures) by converting different definitions of thread pitch between Gazebo and DART.

I'm targeting this PR to gazebo6 since I believe this doesn't break API/ABI compatibility, but please let me know this should target to default.
summary.html:
This pull request updates the DART interface for DART 5.0. Major code changes were made in the part of Model assembling.

In DART 5.0, links (dart::BodyNode) and joints cannot be created individually. It should be created through its Model (dart::Skeleton) in the order of tree spanning like BFS or DFS. Gazebo however allows to create links and joints individually by parsing a SDF file in serial order using Model::Load(), and it doesn't guarantee that links and joints are parsed in the tree spanning order. That being said, the complete list of links and joints are required to build a dart::Skeleton.

It seems Model::Load() doesn't parse the joints under some condition so I put the model assembling code in DARTModel::Init(). After that, I found an issue that some code attempts to access member functions of Link and Joint in Model::Load() when DART objects are not created because Model::Init() is not called yet. I think they shouldn't be called before Joint and Link are initialized but I leave it since it looks out of scope of this PR.

I used caching method to resolve this issue. If a setter function is called before it's ready to be called then it caches the value or the function call itself (to avoid copy-and-paste the logic that used in the setter function), and returns when the corresponding getter function is called. This caching method doesn't work well for all the kind of setter/getter functions because many of them doesn't have one-to-one relationship (e.g., Joint::setAxis() and Joint::setGlobalAxis()), but this is the best solution I can think as of now. Please let me know if there is better idea.

Also, this PR partially fixes DARTScrewJoint issue by converting different definitions of thread pitch between Gazebo and DART.

I'm targeting this PR to gazebo6 since I believe this doesn't break API/ABI compatibility, but please let me know this should target to default.

values.description:
[This](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1gui_1_1EntityMaker.html) is the current structure:

![makers.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3750000366-makers.png)

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

![makers2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/601007612-makers2.png)

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

* PIMPLized

* Using `ign-math`

* Added `ModelMaker_TEST` and `LightMaker_TEST`.
values.title: Makers refactoring

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

![makers2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/601007612-makers2.png)

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

* PIMPLized

* Using `ign-math`

* Added `ModelMaker_TEST` and `LightMaker_TEST`.
summary.html:
This is the current structure:

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

  • Removed MeshMaker and g_meshCreateAct because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

  • Removed BoxMaker, CylinderMaker and SphereMaker because they had only one function being used. That common function became ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape, which takes the new enum SimpleShapes.

  • BuildingMaker is not derived from EntityMaker anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

  • All makers now use the same MouseMove and MouseRelease from the EntityMaker base class. Removed MouseDrag and MousePush since they were not used.

  • Snapping to grid has been centralized in the ModelManipulator and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

  • PIMPLized

  • Using ign-math

  • Added ModelMaker_TEST and LightMaker_TEST.

We were requiring a larger version (3.0.5) corresponding to a prerelease. Now that 3.0.0 is officially released, we should just require that version instead.

This is urgent. Jenkins builds fail without this:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-gazebo_6.0-devel-utopic-amd64/30/

values.description:
Merge forward a few pull requests that went into gazebo5. This was originally submitted as pull request #1819, but was declined until 6.0.0 was released.

* pull request #1808: Use ToSDF functions to simplify physics_friction test
* pull request #1809: Initialize sigact struct fields that valgrind said were being used uninitialized
* pull request #1813: Add missing ogre includes to ensure macros are properly defined
* 52c93cc: Include ogre_gazebo.h in SelectionBuffer.cc, which wasn't part of pull request #1813 since this file didn't use the OGRE_VERSION macros in gazebo5

[trusty nvidia build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/408/) is clean except for two expected test failures:

* gzTest.SDF is fixed by pull request #1832
* INTEGRATION_world_reset (issue #1672)
values.title: Merge gazebo5 to gazebo6

values.description:
* update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor.  The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

* inertia scaling: 

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2142), [AddCylinderLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2172), and [AddSphereLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2200)

    1. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    1. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

* convert `ModelData` class to to ign math

* added test
values.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

summary.raw:
* update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor.  The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

* inertia scaling: 

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2142), [AddCylinderLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2172), and [AddSphereLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2200)

    1. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    1. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

* convert `ModelData` class to to ign math

* added test
summary.html:
• update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor. The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

  • inertia scaling:

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: AddBoxLink, AddCylinderLink, and AddSphereLink

    2. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    3. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

  • convert ModelData class to to ign math

  • added test

values.description:
As suggested in pull request #1794, screw- and gearbox- specific joint properties are now added to the model property tree on the left panel

Added a test to verify joint msgs are filled properly and noticed that the friction values are not always correct depending on joint type and physics engine. Specifically [GetParam("friction")](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/979175e32c0c0e7c964cf0c629ff01c536d3c117/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc?at=default#Joint.cc-559) is used but not all physics engines support this param I think. I can ticket an issue for this if it's not already there
values.title: Display gearbox and screw joint properties in property tree

summary.raw:
As suggested in pull request #1794, screw- and gearbox- specific joint properties are now added to the model property tree on the left panel

Added a test to verify joint msgs are filled properly and noticed that the friction values are not always correct depending on joint type and physics engine. Specifically [GetParam("friction")](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/979175e32c0c0e7c964cf0c629ff01c536d3c117/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc?at=default#Joint.cc-559) is used but not all physics engines support this param I think. I can ticket an issue for this if it's not already there
summary.html:
As suggested in pull request #1794, screw- and gearbox- specific joint properties are now added to the model property tree on the left panel

Added a test to verify joint msgs are filled properly and noticed that the friction values are not always correct depending on joint type and physics engine. Specifically GetParam("friction") is used but not all physics engines support this param I think. I can ticket an issue for this if it's not already there

values.title: Random velocity plugin

summary.raw:
A plugin for the swarm project. This plugin will apply a random velocity, given some constraints, to a link in a model. We will be using this to produce a simple random walk.

[No gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/543)

[nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/419)

[Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/420)
summary.html:
A plugin for the swarm project. This plugin will apply a random velocity, given some constraints, to a link in a model. We will be using this to produce a simple random walk.

No gpu clean

nvidia

Homebrew

values.description:
This pull request integrate two MLCP solvers from Bullet, with tests in test/integration/physics_solvers.cc.   

It is [pull request 1764](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1764/bullet-mlcp-solvers-integrated-part-2-of/diff).
values.title: bullet MLCP solvers integration

summary.raw:
This pull request integrate two MLCP solvers from Bullet, with tests in test/integration/physics_solvers.cc.   

It is [pull request 1764](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1764/bullet-mlcp-solvers-integrated-part-2-of/diff).
summary.html:
This pull request integrate two MLCP solvers from Bullet, with tests in test/integration/physics_solvers.cc.

It is pull request 1764.

values.description:
The [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-vivid-amd64/ws/abi_checker/logs/gazebo/branch:%20gazebo6/log.txt) detected a missing header in our installation. All our physics engines implementation of FixedJoint.hh use this header. 

A backport to gazebo6 (gazebo5 and before branches do not have it) would probably be a good thing.
values.title: Add the installation of FixedJoint.hh header

summary.raw:
The [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-vivid-amd64/ws/abi_checker/logs/gazebo/branch:%20gazebo6/log.txt) detected a missing header in our installation. All our physics engines implementation of FixedJoint.hh use this header. 

A backport to gazebo6 (gazebo5 and before branches do not have it) would probably be a good thing.
summary.html:
The ABI checker detected a missing header in our installation. All our physics engines implementation of FixedJoint.hh use this header.

A backport to gazebo6 (gazebo5 and before branches do not have it) would probably be a good thing.

values.description: Backport of pull request #1841
values.title: Add the installation of FixedJoint.hh header (->gazebo6)

summary.raw: Backport of pull request #1841
summary.html: Backport of pull request #1841

values.description:
While working on the circular dependency problem I ran into the need for sensor conversion between SDF and msgs. This pull request adds conversions for camera, ray, and contact. I didn't do all the sensors in order to keep this pull request small.

[No gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/560) had one failing test is fixed in e13251b
values.title: Circular dependencies part3

summary.raw:
While working on the circular dependency problem I ran into the need for sensor conversion between SDF and msgs. This pull request adds conversions for camera, ray, and contact. I didn't do all the sensors in order to keep this pull request small.

[No gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/560) had one failing test is fixed in e13251b
summary.html:
While working on the circular dependency problem I ran into the need for sensor conversion between SDF and msgs. This pull request adds conversions for camera, ray, and contact. I didn't do all the sensors in order to keep this pull request small.

No gpu had one failing test is fixed in e13251b

values.description:
Implements a logical camera that reports pose information about models that fall within a frustum.

[This SDF pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/207) is required.

[No GPU](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/561) is good except for the tests that require the above SDF pull request.
values.title: Logical camera

summary.raw:
Implements a logical camera that reports pose information about models that fall within a frustum.

[This SDF pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/207) is required.

[No GPU](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/561) is good except for the tests that require the above SDF pull request.
summary.html:
Implements a logical camera that reports pose information about models that fall within a frustum.

This SDF pull request is required.

No GPU is good except for the tests that require the above SDF pull request.

values.description:
The ABI checker detected several problems with our Bullet headers, probably doing a stricter compilation of them. Seems like BulletRaySensor code was not in use, so I remove it.

The failing builds are those prior to 14 and the good one with this PR is 15:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/API_ABI%20checker/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-vivid-amd64/
values.title: Fix bullet headers includes. Required for ABI checking

summary.raw:
The ABI checker detected several problems with our Bullet headers, probably doing a stricter compilation of them. Seems like BulletRaySensor code was not in use, so I remove it.

The failing builds are those prior to 14 and the good one with this PR is 15:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/API_ABI%20checker/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-vivid-amd64/
summary.html:
The ABI checker detected several problems with our Bullet headers, probably doing a stricter compilation of them. Seems like BulletRaySensor code was not in use, so I remove it.

The failing builds are those prior to 14 and the good one with this PR is 15: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/API_ABI%20checker/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-vivid-amd64/

values.description:
While removing DEPRECATIONS I ran across a case where iterating over an enum would be useful. So I got sidetracked.

See the `EnumIface_TEST` and the `EnumIterator` class for example usage.

Coverage:
![coverage.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2348393814-coverage.png)

[No gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/568)
